115111.content:
A part of of her wanted to use every last particle to see what would happen. With the particles combined with her powers she could easily surpass Giant Man or either Wasp and was eager to see the results.

But in the back of her head was still that reasonable voice. She couldn't be certain exactly what WOULD happen and Nadia probably wouldn't like the results.

While Nadia was distracted, Kamala slid through an open window, keeping her treasure in her arms. When she was away from the house, Kamala returned to normal size sprinted away before slowing into a nonchalant walk, looking for a good, wide area to test her potential new size. It would also be good if there were some larger buildings around so she could gauge she just how big she would get.

Now she was finally free to unleash the Pym particles and see what they could really do! She popped them open and without activating her powers she started to grow.

She waited and looked around.Her surroundings shrunk, a sensation that wasn't new to her, though her growth was slower than usual. It felt... different. She wasn't stretching herself, instead new tissue was forming by the second. At first it felt painful, but then it felt invigorating like she knew she was getting stronger by the second. She soon towered over houses, reaching and surpassing her usual limit, then kept growing as though nothing had happened.

Kamala had heard the Pym Particles could strain the users mind and body, which is why Henry and Nadia were reluctant to grow, but she actually felt pretty great. Was this because she was used to size changing? Or because she was an Inhuman?

Looking around even the tallest houses only came to her knees and she felt stronger than she had ever been. This was great!

11533222222222211.content:
On the ruins of Titan, the heroes had fought Thanos to a standstill. Nebula saw her chance. She leapt forward, knocking Iron Man aside, and using her cybernetic arm, she delivered a shock to Thanos's hand, loosening his grip on the Infinity Gauntlet. Before the Earth's heroes could react, she herself had pulled the gauntlet from his hand. The power it contained flowed through her and was almost more than she could bear--but she knew she could not stay. With the power of the Space Stone, she let the Gauntlet pull her towards one of the two remaining stones. The Mind Stone.

In Wakanda, Shuri had managed to separate Vision's mind from the Infinity Stone which formed the core of his brain. With Wanda fighting in the battle, though, they had no way to destroy it. They wouldn't even get the chance. Nebula appeared in the lab and took the newly-detached Mind Stone from Vision's forehead where it still lay. In another cloud of blue space-warping energy, Nebula vanished again.

On Titan, Nebula reappeared in front of Dr. Strange. "Now, wizard. You will submit to my power and surrender the last Stone." Against the power of the Mind Stone, he could not resist and surrendered the stone to her. She had now completed the Infinity Gauntlet, and had the power of a god. But unlike her adoptive father, she did not feel the need to destroy half the universe. Instead, she would make it all her plaything.

In an instant, the world returned to the way it was before Thanos began assembling the gauntlet. Those who had fought him and his forces would still remember what had happened as if a dream, but things were back to the way they should be, more or less, but with a cruel and bitter new goddess.

Now, Nebula thought, what should be her first decree as the new goddess of the universe?

12532.content:
(this was addded by SUPERFAN)

It all started when Luthor was half-way through his first term as President of the United States.

Zatanna the Magician performed at a special charity benefit for the "Earthquake Widows And Orphans Fund" in Gotham City. She had just finished her act, to a standing ovation. And, upon returning to her dressing room, she found a boquet of American Beauty roses on the make-up table.

The note pinned to the tissue-paper wrapping read:

"Congratulations! From your biggest fan."

In place of a signature, however, was the silhouette of a bat.

Smiling to herself, Zee smelled the roses. The moment she did so, however, she was hit by a wave of vertigo. She only had time enough to sit down, on the chair in front of the vanity table, before passing out.

The moment she did so, a strange figured appeared in the mirror!

This golden-masked figure wore a red cloak over matching cover-alls and boots. It also had a red, Pilgrim-like hat, with a golden capital "a" surrounded by a golden circle. And, the only indication it gave that it was male was when it emerged from the mirror, like a swimmer emerging from a YMCA pool, and spoke aloud.

"It looks like the narco-hypnotic scent of these genetically-engineered roses worked! I wonder how Pamela Isley would react if she knew that Calculator had leaked her botanical secrets all over the Internet? Along with the technology behind Mirror Master's unique teleportation and the Mad Hatter's mind-controlling microchips!"

The stranger chuckled as he answered his own question.

"She'd probably cause Arkham Asylum to break out into pure...Anarky!"
12532.title: Zatanna

choices: "...with everyone else in the world shrunk down to six inches tall!"
"...by becoming a hundred-foot tall giantess (costume and all)!"
125321.content:
(this was added by SUPERFAN)

Anarky now positioned the unconscious magician so that she was sitting upright in her chair. He paused momentarily, to ogle her fishnet-stockinged legs. Then, he placed her top hat back on her head. But, with a small device hidden behind each of her monogrammed earrings.

"Listen closely, Zatanna. You are now under my power. When you wake up, I want you to shrink me small enough to fit in your pocket. After that? Well..."

* * * * *

Bruce Wayne was pleasantly surprised to get Zatanna's invitation to dinner in her hotel suite. He accepted without hesitation, and arrived at 8:00 PM, later that evening. He found her ready and waiting, still wearing her stage costume.

"New York char-broiled sirloin? Dom Perignon, with Waterford crystal glasses? What's the occasion, Zee?"

"I'm just celebrating my first crime-free gig, in Gotham, in the last five years."

They engaged in similar small talk for the rest of the meal. Then, just as Bruce was about to pour some after-dinner coffee, he noticed something strange.

"You know, if I didn't know better, I'd swear that this coffee pot was the Larko Lamp."

Whereupon, Zatanna replied: "ecurB enyaW, emoceb ekoms! retnE eht pmal!"

Before the man who was secretly the Caped Crusader of Gotham City could react, he had become a cloud of gray smoke going down the spout of what clearly not a coffee pot!

Of course, with no one holding it, the Larko Lamp should have fallen to the carpeted floor of the suite. But, Zatanna uttered another backwards-spell to levitate it into her hands. She then uttered a third spell, making it small enough to fit in the empty diamond setting of a gold ring on her right hand.

When this had been accomplished, she waved her left hand while saying:

"ecurB, egreme-er sa eht taB-eineg. yletelpmoC tneidebo ot em."

This resulted in a second cloud of smoke. The top of which became the upper torso of the legendary Batman. But, with his arms criss-crossed. And, even more strangely, with the bat-ears of his mask covered by a yellow turban!

"What is your wish, My Mistress?"

"I wish to be worshipped as a goddess..."
125321.title: continue

choices: ...having her feet massaged, and shoes shined, by the mini-JLA.
...having the Bat-genie make love to her!
1253211.content:
As a result of this wish, Zatanna became the only normal-sized person in the world. Everyone else was reduced in size, accordingly, along with their possessions and places of residence. There were some exceptions, however.

Zatanna let the White House in Washington, DC. remain normal-size, so she could make it her palace. But, the city of Washington, itself, now resembled a proportionately small diorama of the USA's capital city, spread out across half the front lawn of the White House.

The other exceptions, not as publicly visible, were the Tower of Fate, near Salem, Massachusetts. And, New Themiscyra (aka Paradise Island), somewhere in that area of the southern North Atlantic that most people called...the Bermuda Triangle.

Diana, the Amazon Crown Princess better known as Wonder Woman, was en route to Massachusetts in her Invisible Plane to meet with Dr. Fate. The legendary wizard of the Justice Society had telepathically contacted her, requesting that she meet with him and the Spectre at his abode, to plan a suitable course of action.

For, at that moment, there were few others who were aware of the reality change that had occurred!

When she finally did arrive, she was teleported into the obelisk-like tower, where she saw Dr. Fate and the Spectre gazing into a crystal ball, at Zatanna...
1253211.title: "...with everyone else in the world shrunk...

12532111.content:
"Ohhhhhhh! Oh, YES!!! Oh, Flash. You have such marvelous little hands!"

This was how Zatanna was responding to the super-speed massage being given by Wally West to her fishnet-clad feet. At the same time, Hawkman was flying back-and-forth beneath her Oval Office desk, applying shoe polish to the high-heel she usually wore on her left foot. The one for her right foot had already been polished, and was now being shined by the Elongated Man!

"I hope you boys are doing a good job, down there," she called out to them.

"Yes, Goddess!" they replied in unison: "Nothing less will ever please us."

"This blasphemy cannot be allowed to continue," growled the Spectre, as the crystal ball went dark.

"I agree," replied Dr. Fate: "But, you cannot confront her, directly. The Batman serves her as a djinn. If she unleashes him against you, she will empathically convert the blind faith of her shrunken worshippers into extra power for him. The extra power that would require of _you_, to subdue him, would destroy the Earth as well!"

"Do you have a better idea, Mage of Order?"

"Actually, I think I do," replied Wonder Woman.

* * * * *

As it turned out, her plan called for the recruitment of Boston "Deadman" Brand, and the Phantom Stranger. Who was sent for, first?
12532111.title: ...having her feet massaged, and shoes shined, ...

125321111.content:
The super-villainess known as Giganta had been capable of growing to a height of one hundred feet, prior to the reality-shift. Now that she was as small as the rest of the world, however, she could only grow to a height of ten feet. Although, that still made her enormous, from their point of view!

So, when Boston "Deadman" Brand used his ghostly powers to take over one of the guards at the Federal Metahuman Detention Facility (a.k.a. "the Slab"), the first thing he did was deactivate the neuro-electrical dampening headband that kept Giganta from concentrating enough to utilize her super-growth power.

Klaxons began blaring as the ten-foot tall giantess shattered her way up through the roof of the prison wing that held her cell. And, before any of the guards in the watchtowers could fire off a shot, she had fled through a teleportal shaped like an Egyptian ankh!

A second later, Giganta emerged into the "foyer" of the Tower of Fate.

"Are you all right, Boston?" asked Wonder Woman.

"Just fine, Princess! And, so's your old sparring partner."

"Are you ready for Phase I?"

The possessed redhead nodded, whereupon Dr. Fate activated another teleportal.

"May the Lords of Order smile upon us," he intoned. And, Giganta entered the teleportal, emerging...
125321111.title: Deadman

choices: ...the Phantom Stranger and the Atom, at Ivytown University.
...the Phantom Stranger and Batman in Gotham City.
1253211111.content:
"Code Red! Code Red! Security breach on the front lawn. Repeat: security breach on the front lawn! Potential Class-A threat. This is not a drill. Repeat: this is not a drill!"

As Giganta (currently possessed by Deadman) advanced upon the main entrance to the White House, a hundred crimson-clad figures suddenly flew up into the air, blocking "her" path. These were Zatanna the Goddess' first line of defense: the Amazonian mercenaries of Bana-Migdahl. Each one wearing a high-tech suit of "Rocket Red" armor!

"Attention, giantess!" declared the leader, over a built-in public announcer: "Go back wherever it is you came from. No one may approach the Palace of the Goddess without her leave! Go back! Or, suffer the consequences."

"Consequences/schmonsequences. Let's get this party STARTED!"

So, they gave Giganta "her" wish.

* * * * *

In the meantime, Phase 2 was about to start. This involved...
1253211111.title: ...on the White House lawn.

choices: Catwoman and the Stranger go directly there.
They make one little stop first.
12532111112.content:
I am called the Phantom Stranger. And, in the universe that existed before the First Crisis, Jason Todd--the second Robin--had been killed by the Joker. But, not so, in this reality.

In this one, the one altered by Zatanna the "Goddess," I rescued Jason Todd...micro-seconds before the explosion of the time bomb planted by the Joker!

I brought him to the Himalayan land of Nanda Parbat, to recuperate. For, I sensed that he would play a major role in the fate of this world in the very near-future. That role began five years ago, when Bruce Wayne was spinally injured in a "car crash." Or, at least, that is how the shrunken inhabitants of this world remember it. In their minds, Bruce Wayne became a paraplegic recluse before the coming of the Goddess. And, since then, in gratitude for having been healed by her, he has been the high priest of her temple in Gotham City.

But, that Bruce Wayne is merely a double! One of a series of phyto-genetic clones created by a Zatanna-worshipping Pamela Isley, to disguise the fact that the real Bruce Wayne is no more. That he has virtually ceased to exist since he, as the "Bat-genie," granted his mistress that fateful wish.

It is Jason Todd who is now the Dark Knight of Gotham. Trying to organize a resistance movement composed of the psychically immune. That is; those who were not affected by the reality shift...and remember how things should truly be. Unfortunately, most of them have been rounded up by the Zatanna-worshipping police and committed to Arkham Asylum for the Criminally Insane.

That is why the new Batman occasionally raids Arkham. Arranging break-outs of the psychically immune with the help of the same person I now seek the aid of: Catwoman!

The three of us meet in the now-derelict movie theater where the first Dark Knight was truly born.

"Jay's told me a lot about you, Stranger. Which, I admit, isn't much! So, what can I do for you?"

My reply is blunt: "I need your help breaking into the White House."
12532111112.title: PHASE II

choices: conitnue from the pov of Superman vs. Batman.
continue from the pov of the Phantom Stranger.
125321111122.content:
Catwoman's reply was instinctive and unequivocal: "SAY WHAT?"

I explained to her that, if I used my mystic teleportation power, my arrival would immediately be detected by Zatanna. That is why I needed someone to infiltrate the White House for me. Someone with almost-superhuman stealth, without it being supernatural.

"Let's say I agree to this crazy request. What do you want me to steal once I'm inside? And, what's in it for me?"

"The source of Zatanna's god-like power," I replied (answering her questions in the same order): "And, the freedom to resume your old life of crime, without living in fear of being incarcerated at Arkham as a heretic."

As if on cue, I sensed him approaching, just moments before he crashed down through the roof.

"Blasphemers!" shouted Superman (Zatanna's Secretary of Defense): "In the interest of homeland security, and in the name of the Goddess, I place you under arrest!"

"Go!" yelled the Batman: "I'll hold him off!"

"Jay, no!" exclaimed Catwoman.

She tried to leap to his side. But, not even she could dodge the Phantom Stranger. The next thing she knew, we were in the Ivytown University office of Professor Raymond Palmer. Also known as...the Atom.

"Forgive the intrusion, Professor. But, we have need of your assistance."
125321111122.title: They make one little stop first.

choices: Return to the Phase I fight between Giganta/Deadman and the Rocket Red Amazons.
1253211111222.content:
Prof. Palmer showed us the Hyatt Time Pool (named for his late mentor). It was a chronospatial anomaly that resembled a white, six-pointed star containing multi-colored concentric circles.

"Before the Goddess game, I used to make all manner of trips into the past. Albeit, only after reducing myself to one-inch tall. For, as you can see for yourselves, no one of normal size could fit through that aperture!"

I replied that, with Zatanna having shrunk the rest of the world to only six inches tall, "...the two of you will have to shrink proportionately smaller. To the pre-shift equivalent of one-sixth of an inch!"

Prof. Palmer frowned: "The scientist in me still wishes you had more concrete proof of this reality shift. But, as a teacher, I resent the way I have to shovel anti-scientific propaganda down my pupils' throats, while lecturing on the history of nuclear physics!"

So saying, he then asked Catwoman if she was ready. She nodded. Whereupon, he embraced her to him (causing a brief mutual blush) and pressed a switch on his size-and-weight control belt. Seconds later, I literally had the two of them in the palms of my cupped hands!!

"Have you set the co-ordinates accordingly, Professor?"

He nodded: "If they were correct, we'll arrive at the same moment Giganta came through that teleportal you mentioned. The alarms over her presence drowning out any going off as the result of detecting ours."

I nodded in response. After which, I opened my hands and dropped the unusual duo into the Time Pool.
1253211111222.title: continue from the pov of the Phantom Stranger.

choices: ...sound asleep, with the magic ring on her right hand above the blankets.
12532111112221.content:
"Let's get this party STARTED!" exclaimed the possessed redhead. So, the Rocket Reds decided to fulfill her wish.

Within seconds, "Giganta" was being dive-bombed by the armor-clad Amazons. Wrist-mounted lasers firing from their gauntlets. Miniature rockets being fired from shoulder-mounted launchers. And, kung fu punches and kicks (learned from Madame Shiva, herself) amplified by their exo-skeletal arms and legs.

All these were used against "Giganta." But, "she" only found them as annoying as mosquito bites would be to a normal-sized person. Conversely, however, Deadman was able to use his host body's once-simian musculature and instincts to leap and tumble about. Sometimes, returning the kicks used against "her." And, sometimes swatting the Rocket Reds like someone normal-sized would swat a fly!

"Just call me 'Queen Kong,' ladies!"

Meanwhile, just moments earlier, Catwoman and the Atom had rematerialized beneath the bed of "the Goddess." The Atom restored them both to "normal" height, before taking a quick peek outside. Seeing that the proverbial coast was clear, Catwoman fired the grappling hook from her "cat's-claw" gun straight up into the air.

The claw landed on top of the bed's footboard, activating the micro-electronic winch attached to the gun. Drawing both Catwoman and the Atom upwards as it reeled in the steel filament cord, When they reached the top, they saw an apparently naked Zatanna...
12532111112221.title: Return to the Phase I fight between Giganta/Dea...

choices: ...the Bat-genie emerged from beneath Zatanna's blanket!
125321111122211.content:
"There it is!" exclaimed the Atom (unintentionally belaboring the obvious): "Remember; all we have to do is grab it, and the Bat-genie is ours to command."

Whereupon, he and Catwoman crept along the top of the bed's footboard unti they were parallel to Zatanna's blanket-covered right foot. Then, they jumped down on the blanket, so they could begin army-crawling toward her hand.

Two minutes later, they had reached their objective.

"I don't suppose you carry a jar of cold cream in your bag of tricks?" the Atom asked (being careful to whisper).

"Not quite!" replied Catwoman, as she removed a half-gallon plastic bottle from her knapsack, along with a pump-action insecticide spraygun .

"What's the yellow stuff in the bottle?" the Atom inquired, suspiciously.

"Baby oil. Sometimes, I have to crawl through vents too narrow for even _my_ svelte figure! So, I use atomized baby oil to further eliminate friction. Care to do the honors?"

The atom quickly-but-quietly removed the cap of the spraygun and filled it with some of the baby oil. After which, he restored the cap to its rightful place, before manipulating the T-shaped pump handle. He then began lubricating--under Catwoman's guidance--certain spots within the area encircled by Zatanna's ring.

When they had completed three hundred sixty degrees, they immediately started tugging on the ring. Unfortunately, that is when...
125321111122211.title: ...sound asleep, with the magic ring on her rig...

choices: She begins by punishing the Atom.
1253211111222111.content:
The top half of the blanket flew up and backward, like a tidal wave. Covering both Catwoman and the Atom before they could even move!

"Mistress! Mistress! Please, awaken!"

"Huh? What?"

"Intruders, Mistress! They seek to steal me from you. I sensed them as they attempted to make off with my lamp."

"Oh, really! Where are they, now?"

"Beneath the blanket."

There was a brief moment, as the blanket was removed, that Catwoman and the Atom were blinded by the return of bright light. When their eyes had adjusted, however, they saw Zatanna glaring down at them. With her left hand clutching the top half of the blanket to her chest. And, her right arm protectively embracing the Bat-genie's shoulders!

"I don't know how you two got in here," she muttered: "But, you're going to regret spoiling the afterglow of our little...bat-a-tete!"
